q: to Ken Auletta 's sources, Eric Schmidt 's appetite for the job waned not just because of the China decision, but because Google was struggling to deal with the success of Facebook and increased scrutiny from regulators. Google was becoming defensive. All of their social-network efforts had faltered. Facebook had replaced them as the hot tech company, the place vital engineers wanted to work, Ken Auletta writes. "Complaints about Google bureaucracy intensified. Governments around the world were lobbing grenades at Google over privacy, copyright, and size issues. The "don't be evil" brand was getting tarnished,

His film study has probably been the area of biggest difference this year from last year in terms of his growth as a football player," Green Bay secondary coach Darren Perry said. That's how you continue to be productive by continuing to find a way to get better each year. My hats off to Tramon Williams . Tramon Williams was fifth in the NFL with six regular-season interceptions, but burst on the national scene in the playoffs. His late pick of Philadelphia quarterback Michael Vick solidified the Packers' Wild-Card victory. In

I want people to know that after nine days of protests, the monuments are safe, Zahi Hawass said. "If anything happens, I will announce it." Sergio Marchionne 's statement said. "I regret the remark, which I consider inappropriate." Sergio Marchionne said Chrysler remains grateful for the bailouts and noted that no other parties were willing to assist in Chrysler's recovery. The two governments levied interest rates that, although appropriate at the time, are above current market conditions, he continued. "This was done with the full support and understanding of the members of Chrysler Group LLC." Chrysler hopes to reach a deal with banks by the end of March to refinance the loans,

Bush would frequently express his belief that history will be kind to us, despite his rejection by the voters. Like any other Bill Clinton , legacy matters greatly to George H.W. executive chairman, "a lot of my time" will be devoted to dealing with regulators and other government officials, Eric Schmidt said. "We've got very complicated government issues," he said, adding that we move quickly, and we tend to be disruptive at scale. European Union officials opened a formal antitrust probe last year into Google search results, while in China the company opted to shut down its mainland search engine rather than censor results for user queries.
